intro: Securinega neopeltandra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a persistent, fleshy aril. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
